sentences.en: a city ordinance that says parks must be closed at 11 p.m.
sentences.cn: 规定公园须于夜间11点钟关闭的城市条例

sentences.en: A new ordinance requires builders to get permits before tearing down structures.
sentences.cn: 一项新的政令要求建筑商在拆除建筑物之前必须征得许可.

sentences.en: Inclosed towards the north and south by ranges to the ordinance.
sentences.cn: 藉着对法令的范围向北方和向南方围起来.

sentences.en: Judging the legality of the ordinance is within the province of the courts.
sentences.cn: 判决这条法令是否合法是由法院来决定的.

sentences.en: Law is an ordinance of reason for the common good.
sentences.cn: 法律是维护公众利益的理性条令.

sentences.en: Obey these instructions as a lasting ordinance for you and your descendants.
sentences.cn: 24这例,你们要守着,作为你们和你们子孙永远的定例.

sentences.en: Penn Central involved a New York historic preservation ordinance.
sentences.cn: 宾州的运输受到了纽约州一项历史文物保护法规的牵连.

sentences.en: South Carolina passed an " ordinance of secession ", and prepared for war.
sentences.cn: 南卡罗来纳州通过了 “ 脱离联邦法令 ”, 准备打仗.

sentences.en: The burning of leaves was prohibited by a town ordinance.
sentences.cn: 一项城市规章规定,禁止焚烧树叶.

sentences.en: The case involved a Chicago ordinance banning the use of detergents containing phosphates.
sentences.cn: 该案涉及到芝加哥一项禁止使用含有磷酸脂的洗涤剂的法规.

sentences.en: The city passed an ordinance compelling all outdoor lighting to be switched off at 9.00 PM.
sentences.cn: 该市通过一条法令强令晚上九点关闭一切室外照明.

sentences.en: The French Foreign Legion was founded by a Royal Ordinance, written on a small piece of official Prench War Office notepaper dated March 9 th, 1931.
sentences.cn: 法国外籍兵团是按照皇家的一项法令建立的, 这项法令记录在一小页法国陆军部公函信笺上, 日期是1931年3月9日.

sentences.en: The Objectionable Publications Ordinance ( Cap . 150 . 1975 Ed. ) is repealed.
sentences.cn: 《不良刊物条例》 ( 第150章, 1975年版 ) 现予以废除.

sentences.en: The Seventh Circuit found that the ordinance did place a burden on interstate commerce.
sentences.cn: 第七巡回法庭发现,这项法规的确为州际商业增加了负担.

sentences.en: Then introduce your ordinance, and we'll see what can be done.
sentences.cn: 然后把你的章程提出来, 我们来看看有什么办法.

sentences.en: This is to be a lasting ordinance for the generations to come.
sentences.cn: 这要作你们世世代代永远的定例.

trans.tran_cn: <正>条例，法令，传统的风俗习惯，[宗]仪式，（尤指）圣餐式
trans.tran_en: a law, usually of a city or town, that forbids or restricts an activity
